intro: Phacelia circinata f. vulgaris, commonly known as the common phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, ovate leaves and produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its often hairy stems and showy flowers. Phacelia circinata f. vulgaris is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
